derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (denoting something extraordinary considered to be an omen): from Latin prodigium 'portent'

entry.tran: （有音乐、数学或体育等天赋的）天才，奇才，神童
entry.def: A prodigy is someone young who has a great natural ability for something such as music, mathematics, or sport.

means.word_mean: 1. an unusually gifted or intelligent (young) person; someone whose talents excite wonder and admiration;
2. a sign of something about to happen;

sentences.sentence: "he looked for an omen before going into battle"

means.word_mean: 3. an impressive or wonderful example of a particular quality;

sentences.sentence: "the Marines are expected to perform prodigies of valor"
